info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:06PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HENRY...SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND NORTHEASTERN PATRICK COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF MARTINSVILLE THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 406 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairy Stone State Park, or 7 miles east of Woolwine, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Martinsville... Bassett... Sydnorsville... Ferrum... Endicott... Villa Heights... and Chatmoss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
